[<System.Runtime.Versioning.ObsoletedOSPlatform("android29.0", "This class is obsoleted in this android platform")>]

Docs.summary: Used to help create Preference hierarchies from activities or XML.

remarks.para: Used to help create Preference hierarchies from activities or XML.
In most cases, clients should use PreferenceActivity#addPreferencesFromIntent or PreferenceActivity#addPreferencesFromResource(int).
This member is deprecated. Use the AndroidX Preference Library for consistent behavior across all devices. For more information on using the AndroidX Preference Library see Settings.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Property PreferenceDataStore As IPreferenceDataStore

public: virtual property Android::Preferences::IPreferenceDataStore ^ PreferenceDataStore { Android::Preferences::IPreferenceDataStore ^ get(); void set(Android::Preferences::IPreferenceDataStore ^ value); };
public virtual Android.Preferences.IPreferenceDataStore? PreferenceDataStore { get; set; }
member this.PreferenceDataStore : Android.Preferences.IPreferenceDataStore with get, set

Docs.param: The PreferenceDataStore to be used by this manager.
Docs.summary: Returns the PreferenceDataStore associated with this manager or null if the default android.content.SharedPreferences are used instead. -or- Sets a PreferenceDataStore to be used by all Preferences associated with this manager that don't have a custom PreferenceDataStore assigned via Preference#setPreferenceDataStore(PreferenceDataStore).
Docs.value: The PreferenceDataStore associated with this manager or null if none.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:
Returns the PreferenceDataStore associated with this manager or null if the default android.content.SharedPreferences are used instead.
Property setter documentation:

Sets a PreferenceDataStore to be used by all Preferences associated with this manager that don't have a custom PreferenceDataStore assigned via Preference#setPreferenceDataStore(PreferenceDataStore). Also if the data store is set, the child preferences won't use android.content.SharedPreferences as long as they are assigned to this manager.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Sub SetDefaultValues (context As Context, resId As Integer, readAgain As Boolean)
public: static void SetDefaultValues(Android::Content::Context ^ context, int resId, bool readAgain);
public static void SetDefaultValues (Android.Content.Context? context, int resId, bool readAgain);
.method public static hidebysig void SetDefaultValues(class Android.Content.Context context, int32 resId, bool readAgain) cil managed
static member SetDefaultValues : Android.Content.Context * int * bool -> unit

Docs.param: The context of the shared preferences.
The resource ID of the preference XML file.

Whether to re-read the default values. If false, this method sets the default values only if this method has never been called in the past (or if the #KEY_HAS_SET_DEFAULT_VALUES in the default value shared preferences file is false). To attempt to set the default values again bypassing this check, set readAgain to true.

Note: this will NOT reset preferences back to their default values. For that functionality, use PreferenceManager#getDefaultSharedPreferences(Context) and clear it followed by a call to this method with this parameter set to true.
Docs.summary: Sets the default values from an XML preference file by reading the values defined by each Preference item's android:defaultValue attribute.

remarks.para: Sets the default values from an XML preference file by reading the values defined by each Preference item's android:defaultValue attribute. This should be called by the application's main activity.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Sub SetDefaultValues (context As Context, sharedPreferencesName As String, sharedPreferencesMode As FileCreationMode, resId As Integer, readAgain As Boolean)
public: static void SetDefaultValues(Android::Content::Context ^ context, System::String ^ sharedPreferencesName, Android::Content::FileCreationMode sharedPreferencesMode, int resId, bool readAgain);
public static void SetDefaultValues (Android.Content.Context? context, string? sharedPreferencesName, Android.Content.FileCreationMode sharedPreferencesMode, int resId, bool readAgain);

.method public static hidebysig void SetDefaultValues(class Android.Content.Context context, string sharedPreferencesName, valuetype Android.Content.FileCreationMode sharedPreferencesMode, int32 resId, bool readAgain) cil managed
static member SetDefaultValues : Android.Content.Context * string * Android.Content.FileCreationMode * int * bool -> unit

Docs.param: The context of the shared preferences.
A custom name for the shared preferences file.
The file creation mode for the shared preferences file, such as android.content.Context#MODE_PRIVATE or android.content.Context#MODE_PRIVATE
The resource ID of the preference XML file.

Whether to re-read the default values. If false, this method will set the default values only if this method has never been called in the past (or if the #KEY_HAS_SET_DEFAULT_VALUES in the default value shared preferences file is false). To attempt to set the default values again bypassing this check, set readAgain to true.

Note: this will NOT reset preferences back to their default values. For that functionality, use PreferenceManager#getDefaultSharedPreferences(Context) and clear it followed by a call to this method with this parameter set to true.
Docs.summary: Similar to #setDefaultValues(Context, int, boolean) but allows the client to provide the filename and mode of the shared preferences file.

remarks.para: Similar to #setDefaultValues(Context, int, boolean) but allows the client to provide the filename and mode of the shared preferences file.

format.a: Java documentation for android.preference.PreferenceManager.setDefaultValues(android.content.Context, java.lang.String, int, int, boolean).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetStorageDeviceProtected() cil managed
abstract member SetStorageDeviceProtected : unit -> unit override this.SetStorageDeviceProtected : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Explicitly set the storage location used internally by this class to be device-protected storage.

remarks.para: Explicitly set the storage location used internally by this class to be device-protected storage.

On devices with direct boot, data stored in this location is encrypted with a key tied to the physical device, and it can be accessed immediately after the device has booted successfully, both before and after the user has authenticated with their credentials (such as a lock pattern or PIN).

Because device-protected data is available without user authentication, you should carefully limit the data you store using this Context. For example, storing sensitive authentication tokens or passwords in the device-protected area is strongly discouraged.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
